alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 17 at 5:52PM CDT until June 17 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Beaver County in the Panhandle of Oklahoma... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 552 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles southeast of Turpin, or 16 miles west of Beaver, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported funnel cloud. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Beaver, Forgan, Mocane, Turpin and Floris. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
